intro: Laennecia, commonly known as the "scented bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It comprises several species, most of which are native to Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. The plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, often fragrant flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. Laennecia species typically grow in meadows, woodlands, and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Their flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
